questions.question: In primitive societies, who owned the resources?
questions.correct_answer: Clan chiefs owned the resources in primitive societies.

questions.question: How did different groups interact with each other in early societies?
What happened when caravan routes intersected?
questions.correct_answer: Temporary camps became seasonal fairs when caravan routes intersected.

questions.question: How did markets originate according to the lesson?
questions.correct_answer: Markets originated when fairs developed formal exchange rules independent of tribal customs.

questions.question: Why did merchants receive tokens at fairs?
questions.correct_answer: Merchants received tokens as proof of payment to track daily market rent.

questions.question: What were the earliest forms of tokens made from?
questions.correct_answer: The earliest tokens were made from leather tags.

questions.question: What did tokens eventually evolve into?
questions.correct_answer: Tokens evolved into metal coins bearing the owner's seal.

questions.question: What became the first bank?
questions.correct_answer: The treasury that issued coins became the first bank.

questions.question: What groups emerged to seek valuable goods directly as they moved along exchange chains?
questions.correct_answer: Specialized merchant groups emerged to seek valuable goods directly.

questions.question: What does understanding the evolution from fairs to coins reveal about money?
questions.correct_answer: Understanding this evolution reveals the abstract nature of money itself.
